What is the projected market size & growth rate of the Smart Water Management Market? Market Analysis and Insights Smart Water Management Market Smart water management market is expected to gain market growth in the forecast period of 2022 to 2029. Data Bridge Market Research analyses the market to grow at a CAGR of 11.8% in the above-mentioned forecast period. Smart water management is basically a water management system that made to gather meaningful and actionable information on the flow, pressure and distribution of a city's water. It revolutionizes traditional water distribution with new technologies. It reduce water wastage and to use their energy efficiently. Its main goal is to basically ensure that the infrastructure and energy used to transport water are managed effectively. The factors such as rising shortage of water and growing demand for water conservation are expected to emerge as the significant factors accelerating the growth of smart water management market. In addition to this, the growing global smart city initiatives and the compelling need to replace existing water infrastructure will further aggravate the growth of the smart water management market in the above-mentioned forecast period. The growing demand for sustainable water solutions and need for reducing water loss due to non-revenue water are also projected to boost the growth of the market. However, the dearth of digitally skilled workforce results as a growth restraint for the market. The high initial investments and lack of skilled workforce to implement modern solutions is also expected to hamper the market’s growth. The growing technological advancements in water and waste water treatments such as advanced metering technology and Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition (SCADA) and increasing government initiatives to implement smart water management are also anticipated to generate lucrative opportunities for the smart water management market in the forecast period of 2022 to 2029. The reduced shelf-life of smart meters and low return on income will pose as a challenge for the smart water management market.
